description: Latin liquatus, past participle of liquare (“to melt”).

verbs.description: liquate (third-person singular simple present liquates, present participle liquating, simple past and past participle liquated)

entries.meaning: (metallurgy) To separate by fusion, as a more fusible from a less fusible material.
(obsolete) To cause (something) to become liquid; to liquefy, to melt.
(intransitive, obsolete) To become liquid; to liquefy, to melt.
